Homemade Mac and Cheese with Garlic and Herb Breadcrumbs

Jump to Recipe

If you're craving comfort food at its finest, look no further than this Homemade Mac and Cheese with Garlic and Herb Breadcrumbs. This classic dish combines the creamy goodness of cheddar and Monterey Jack cheeses with perfectly cooked elbow macaroni, creating a rich, indulgent experience that's hard to resist. What sets this recipe apart is the irresistible crunch of garlic and herb breadcrumbs that adds a delightful texture and flavor contrast to the cheesy base. Whether you're hosting a cozy family dinner, planning a potluck, or simply indulging yourself on a rainy day, this mac and cheese is sure to satisfy your cravings. In this article, we’ll guide you through the simple steps to create this gourmet-style dish that’s both easy to prepare and utterly delicious. Get ready to impress your taste buds and those of your loved ones with this ultimate comfort food recipe!

Ingredients

elbow macaroni

Elbow macaroni is a classic choice, but you can substitute it with other pasta shapes like cavatappi or shells for a different texture. When cooking, be sure to salt the water to enhance the pasta's flavor, and cook it just to al dente to prevent it from becoming mushy during baking.

cheddar cheese

Sharp cheddar will give your mac and cheese a robust flavor, but you can mix it with mild cheddar for a creamier taste. If you're looking for healthier options, try using reduced-fat cheddar or substituting some of the cheese with nutritional yeast for a cheesy flavor.

monterey jack cheese

Monterey Jack adds creaminess and a mild flavor. You can substitute it with mozzarella for more stretch or pepper jack for a spicy kick. Mixing different cheeses will enhance the overall flavor profile, so feel free to experiment!

milk

Whole milk gives the best creaminess, but you can substitute with 2% milk or even a non-dairy milk like almond or oat milk for a lighter version. If you want a richer sauce, use half-and-half or add a little cream.

butter

Butter is essential for a rich flavor. If you need a dairy-free option, use margarine or a vegan butter substitute. For a flavor boost, consider browning the butter before adding the flour to create a nuttier taste.

all-purpose flour

All-purpose flour is used for thickening the cheese sauce. If you need a gluten-free option, use a gluten-free flour blend or cornstarch as a thickener. Just be cautious with the amount of cornstarch, as it thickens more quickly.

breadcrumbs

Use panko breadcrumbs for extra crunch, or you can make your own by processing stale bread. For added flavor, consider using seasoned breadcrumbs or mixing in grated Parmesan cheese. You can also substitute with crushed crackers or even finely chopped nuts for a gluten-free option.

garlic powder

Garlic powder adds depth to the dish, but fresh minced garlic can provide a stronger flavor. If you prefer a milder taste, reduce the amount or omit it entirely. You can also experiment with garlic salt instead of regular salt to enhance the flavor.

dried herbs (like thyme or parsley)

Dried herbs add a nice aromatic quality. Fresh herbs can be used as well, but you'll need about three times the amount since they are less concentrated. Experiment with other herbs like oregano or basil for a unique twist.

salt

Salt enhances the flavor, but be cautious if you're using pre-salted cheese or salted butter. Always taste as you go. If you're watching sodium intake, consider using a low-sodium salt or salt substitute.

pepper

Freshly ground black pepper is best for a more pronounced flavor. If you want some heat, consider using cayenne pepper or red pepper flakes. Adjust the amount according to your spice preference.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Oven

    Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). This ensures that your mac and cheese will bake evenly and the topping will become perfectly golden brown.

  • Step 2: Cook the Elbow Macaroni

    Cook the elbow macaroni according to package instructions until al dente (about 7-8 minutes). Drain and set aside. Cooking it al dente prevents the pasta from becoming mushy when baked.

  • Step 3: Make the Cheese Sauce

    In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Once melted, whisk in the flour and cook for about 1 minute until bubbly and light golden. This creates a roux, which is the base for your cheese sauce.

  • Step 4: Add Milk Gradually

    Gradually add the milk while whisking constantly. Keep whisking until the mixture thickens and is smooth, which should take about 5-7 minutes. This step is crucial for a creamy cheese sauce.

  • Step 5: Incorporate the Cheeses

    Remove the saucepan from heat and stir in the shredded cheddar and Monterey Jack cheeses until melted and creamy. Season with salt and pepper according to your taste.

  • Step 6: Combine Macaroni and Cheese Sauce

    In a large bowl, combine the cooked macaroni with the cheese sauce, stirring until the pasta is well coated with the creamy cheese. Ensure every piece of pasta is covered to maximize flavor.

  • Step 7: Prepare the Breadcrumb Topping

    In a small bowl, mix the breadcrumbs, garlic powder, and dried herbs together. This mixture adds a crunchy texture and a burst of flavor on top of your mac and cheese.

  • Step 8: Assemble and Bake

    Transfer the mac and cheese mixture to a greased baking dish. Sprinkle the breadcrumb mixture evenly over the top. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes or until the top is golden brown and crispy.

Frequently Asked Questions

What does 'al dente' mean when cooking pasta?

'Al dente' means the pasta is cooked until it's firm to the bite. This is important for mac and cheese because it will continue to cook in the oven, preventing it from becoming mushy.

How can I avoid burning the butter when melting it?

Melt the butter over medium heat and watch it closely. If you see it starting to brown, reduce the heat immediately. Stir it occasionally to ensure even melting.

What can I substitute if I don’t have breadcrumbs?

If you don’t have breadcrumbs, you can crush crackers or use panko for a crunchier topping. Alternatively, you can omit them for a creamier version.

How do I know if my cheese sauce is thick enough?

Your cheese sauce should coat the back of a spoon. If it drips off too quickly, continue to cook it on medium heat, whisking constantly until it thickens.

What should I do if my mac and cheese is too thick?

If your cheese sauce is too thick, gradually whisk in a little more milk until you reach your desired consistency before mixing it with the macaroni.

How can I make sure my mac and cheese doesn’t stick to the baking dish?

Lightly grease your baking dish with cooking spray or butter before adding the mac and cheese. This will help prevent sticking.

Can I add vegetables to my mac and cheese?

Absolutely! Adding cooked vegetables like broccoli, spinach, or peas can enhance the flavor and nutrition. Just mix them in with the macaroni before adding the cheese sauce.

What’s the best way to store leftovers?

Allow the mac and cheese to cool completely, then store it in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3-5 days. Reheat in the oven or microwave.

How do I know when my mac and cheese is done baking?

Your mac and cheese is done when the top is golden brown and crispy, and the edges are bubbling. If you’re unsure, you can insert a knife in the middle; it should be hot throughout.

Can I make mac and cheese ahead of time?

Yes! You can prepare the mac and cheese up to the baking step, cover it tightly, and refrigerate it for up to 2 days. When you're ready to bake, you may need to add a few extra minutes to the cooking time.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a gluten-free version, substitute the elbow macaroni with gluten-free pasta and use gluten-free breadcrumbs for the topping. To make it vegetarian, ensure the cheeses used are rennet-free. If you want a lighter option, consider using low-fat milk and reduced-fat cheese, though this may slightly alter the creaminess of the dish. Vegan alternatives can be achieved by using plant-based milk and cheese substitutes, along with nutritional yeast for added flavor.

Pairings

For a heartier meal, consider serving the homemade mac and cheese alongside grilled chicken or BBQ ribs, which will provide a nice contrast to the creamy pasta. A side of roasted vegetables, such as Brussels sprouts or asparagus, adds freshness and balances the richness of the dish. For beverages, a crisp lager or a light-bodied white wine like Sauvignon Blanc complements the flavors well. If you're aiming for a more casual setting, pair it with a classic cola or a sweet iced tea.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the mac and cheese in a large, rustic bowl to encourage sharing, and garnish with fresh chopped parsley for a pop of color. Offer extra cheese on the side for those who want a more indulgent experience. A sprinkle of red pepper flakes can also add a touch of heat for those who enjoy a bit of spice. For a fun twist, consider serving it in individual ramekins for a personal touch, perfect for a cozy dinner party or family gathering.

#

Homemade Mac and Cheese with Garlic and Herb Breadcrumbs

40 min
$10
600 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

DairyGluten

Dietary Tags:

Vegetarian

Cuisine:

American

Course:

Main CourseSide Dish

Tags:

Comfort FoodEasy Recipe

Description

Creamy macaroni and cheese topped with crunchy, flavorful breadcrumbs for a delicious twist!

Ingredients

  • elbow macaroni: 8 oz
  • cheddar cheese: 2 cups shredded
  • monterey jack cheese: 1 cup shredded
  • milk: 2 cups
  • butter: 4 tbsp
  • all-purpose flour: 1/4 cup
  • breadcrumbs: 1 cup
  • garlic powder: 1 tsp
  • dried herbs (like thyme or parsley): 1 tsp
  • salt: 1/2 tsp
  • pepper: 1/4 tsp

Date Created:

11/21/2024
